Topic.Title: Tell me they are not crazy

Message.Msg: The biggest risk to this deal will be FCC bureaucrats.

Topic.Title: Tell me they are not crazy

Message.Msg: "An auction may have backfired for T." Exactly. Spectrum auctions have proven to be expensive, very unpredictable and subject to gaming.

Message.Title: Paused, consolidated, and resuming the move higher now!
Message.Msg: T is a much better investment currently than VZ. lower FPE higher dividend yield not attached to iPhone better selection of phones heavy data users going to VZ to bog down their system and free up T system This is a long term no brainer in your 401k, where dividends are not taxible until they are withdrawn (and then its taxes as OI) too bad I'm going to have to sell half my position pretty soon once my return is over 100%, gotta play with house money only once the opportunity presents itself.

Message.Title: Gabby Douglas stands with Tim Tebow
Message.Msg: Congrats Gabby America is so proud of you. You and Tim are shining examples of what can be accomplished with a strong Christian faith and hard work

I agree with you 100%. There's a different between freedom of speach and posting BS that most people don't want to discuss or read about. These old fuddyduddies on this board have nothing better to do so they try to stir the pot until yahoo bans them, then they create a new ID and continue on their delusional path. If they got banned don't you think there is a problem with what they are saying? And no fuddyduddies, its not right wing extreemists that are removing your posts, its just that you suk. They say there are 3 things you normally don't talk about to random people, 1 of those is politics, they don't seem to get that. Oh well, just put em on iggy and they go away for a few weeks until they get banned,then you wash, rinse, and repeat.
Where is the Yahoo political board??? DEM gets you to a stock but GOP just brings up a list of stocks. Well T serves pretty well.

Topic.Title: Paused, consolidated, and resuming the move higher now!

Message.Msg: It was a good try but T must go well below $37 before it can resume the uptrend. See the chart: http://finance.yahoo.com/echarts?s=t#symbol=t;range=1y;compare=;indicator=dividend+sma%2820%29+bollinger+volume+stochasticslow;charttype=candlestick;crosshair=on;ohlcvalues=1;logscale=off;source=undefined; The Stochastic is turning down and has a long way to go. Ignore technicals at your own risk. The 20 DMA is just above $36 but I don't expect it to fall that far.

Message.Msg: What's the time frame on that you think?

Topic.Title: Paused, consolidated, and resuming the move higher now!

Message.Msg: My guess is AT&T will drop below $37 next Tuesday and will continue down to about $36.67 by the end of next week. I don't expect it to go much lower but it is always a good idea to wait until the Stochastic starts back up before buying more. My target is $44 with more dips before we get there.

Topic.Title: Paused, consolidated, and resuming the move higher now!

Message.Msg: Why can't the slow stochastic move horizontally from this level, similar to earlier dates on the chart? Regardless, with earnings mostly out, maybe it's time for the market to cool off for a while. The Fed gathering at Jackson Hole is at the end of August.

Topic.Title: Paused, consolidated, and resuming the move higher now!

Message.Msg: I think he is using Fast Stochastics on this. The Fast is tipping down already whereas the slow is moving sideways currently. I seriously wouldn't expect the FED to do anything until they get an idea of what kind of inflationary measures Europe will be taking. Don't want to cause too much price inflation or they will sap whatever recovery exists with much higher input costs and even higher burden on the consumers. If the ECB can add some help, why leverage the FED during the election runup? Have to see what kind of impact fiscal cliff/resolution has on the dividend rate-- that might have more to do with the future price of T and VZ than anything going on in the market if people dump the stock because of higher tax rate. Although, even after the higher tax, you'd still see a better rate of return than on Treasuries or much of anything else. Have to see what turns out.

Message.Title: You should get 1 more chance to get out of T when it makes its double top
Message.Msg: You should get 1 more chance to get out of T when it makes its double top

Topic.Title: Paused, consolidated, and resuming the move higher now!

Message.Msg: The volume is so low today that I think we may have hit a plateau and may never drop below $37. It looks like the closing price today is going to be very close to the closing price yesterday. Today's trading hit a higher high and a higher low. The lower volume indicates no rush to get either in or out. The stochastic may be moving sidewise.

Topic.Title: Paused, consolidated, and resuming the move higher now!

Message.Msg: The chart shows Slow Stochastic. During uptrends it can stay at elevated levels. One thing people forget about QE is that it needs to be unwound after the economy strengthens. That will be very difficult to do since it will tend to increase rates on the securities being sold back into the market. The Fed will want to shrink their balance sheet which is way beyond anything in past history.

This board is all I need...

Message.Title: After Hours Quotes...
Message.Msg: ... “We have now sunk to a depth at which restatement of the obvious is the first duty of intelligent men.” – George Orwell “To understand what music has to be, you have to live for music. Who's ready to do that?” – Morton Feldman http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JNZL7GkqeRI "The Olympics have just started and the Greeks are already 14 medals in debt.” – conan O’Brien “It is better to hide ignorance, but it is hard to do this when we relax over wine.” – Heraclitus, 510 BC “Once he makes up his mind, he's full of indecision.” - Oscar Levant "The Jim Henson company, which created the Muppets, have cut their ties with Chick-Fil-A because of the company's anti-gay marriage stance. Insiders say the move came after intense pressure from Bert and Ernie." –Jay Leno “According to the estimate of a prominent advertising firm, above 90 per cent, of the earning capacity of the prominent nostrums is represented by their advertising. And all this advertising is based on the well-proven theory of the public's pitiable ignorance and gullibility in the vitally important matter of health.” – Samuel Hopkins Adams “Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.” – Carl Jung "They're calling it the worst drought in 56 years. That seems to me unnecessarily negative. Couldn't it be the best drought in 56 years?" - Jimmy Kimmel http://media.caglecartoons.com/media/cartoons/56/2012/08/02/116280_600.jpg “It is to be regretted that the rich and powerful too often bend the acts of government to their own selfish purposes.” – Andrew Jackson

Message.Title: Ahq (cont.)...
Message.Msg: ... “We have now sunk to a depth at which restatement of the obvious is the first duty of intelligent men.” – George Orwell “To understand what music has to be, you have to live for music. Who's ready to do that?” – Morton Feldman http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JNZL7GkqeRI "The Olympics have just started and the Greeks are already 14 medals in debt.” – conan O’Brien “It is better to hide ignorance, but it is hard to do this when we relax over wine.” – Heraclitus, 510 BC “Once he makes up his mind, he's full of indecision.” - Oscar Levant "The Jim Henson company, which created the Muppets, have cut their ties with Chick-Fil-A because of the company's anti-gay marriage stance. Insiders say the move came after intense pressure from Bert and Ernie." –Jay Leno “According to the estimate of a prominent advertising firm, above 90 per cent, of the earning capacity of the prominent nostrums is represented by their advertising. And all this advertising is based on the well-proven theory of the public's pitiable ignorance and gullibility in the vitally important matter of health.” – Samuel Hopkins Adams “Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.” – Carl Jung "They're calling it the worst drought in 56 years. That seems to me unnecessarily negative. Couldn't it be the best drought in 56 years?" - Jimmy Kimmel http://media.caglecartoons.com/media/cartoons/56/2012/08/02/116280_600.jpg “It is to be regretted that the rich and powerful too often bend the acts of government to their own selfish purposes.” – Andrew Jackson

Message.Title: AHQ (3)...
Message.Msg: ... “Science has ‘explained’ nothing; the more we know the more fantastic the world becomes and the profounder the surrounding darkness.” – Aldous Huxley “Fear is the main source of superstition, and one of the main sources of cruelty. To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.” – Bertrand Russell "Scotland announced that it will legalize gay marriage. I don't know what's bigger news, that Scotland did that or that a country where guys wear plaid skirts didn't already have gay marriage." –Jimmy Fallon “I’d just as soon play tennis with the net down.” – Robert Frost “Science and mathematics [are] much more compelling and exciting than the doctrines of pseudoscience, whose practitioners were condemned as early as the fifth century B.C. by the Ionian philosopher Heraclitus as 'night walkers, magicians, priests of Bacchus, priestesses of the wine-vat, mystery-mongers.' But science is more intricate and subtle, reveals a much richer universe, and powerfully evokes our sense of wonder. And it has the additional and important virtue—to whatever extent the word has any meaning—of being true.” – Carl Sagan “To prepare for the Republican Convention, a strip club in Tampa, Florida has hired a Sarah Palin look-a-like to perform. This stripper is so much like Sarah Palin, she actually has written on her hand, 'take off top, shake breasts, swing around pole." - Jay Leno “Economics is extremely useful as a form of employment for economists.” – John Kenneth Galbraith “Free imagination is the inestimable prerogative of youth and it must be cherished and guarded as a treasure.” – Felix Bloch "Did you hear this big scandal? Eight female badminton players were expelled from the Olympics for trying to lose on purpose. So tragically, they'll never have another chance to play badminton unless they get invited to a picnic." - Conan O'Brien http://media.caglecartoons.com/media/cartoons/100/2012/08/02/116267_600.jpg “He was simply unable to let things be foggy. Since they always are, this kept him pretty active.” – Oppenheimer on Fermi

Message.Title: AHQ (final)...
Message.Msg: ... “One thing you learned being a Cubs fan. When you bought your ticket, you could always count on seeing the bottom of the ninth.” – Joe Garagiola “When I was a young boy, my father taught me that to be a good Catholic, I had to confess at church if I ever had impure thoughts about a girl. That very evening, I had to rush to confess my sin - and the next night, and the next. After a week, I decided religion wasn't for me.” – Fidel Castro "All in all, it’s been a successful trip. Best of all, Romney has checked three countries off the list of '1000 Places To Offend People Before You Die’.” – Stephen Colbert http://media.caglecartoons.com/media/cartoons/147/2012/07/29/116028_600.jpg “I regard the brain as a computer which will stop working when its components fail. There is no heaven or afterlife for broken down computers; that is a fairy story for people afraid of the dark.” – Stephen Hawking “Saudi Arabia's first female athlete will be allowed to compete while wearing a head scarf. The Saudi woman said she was thrilled about the ruling all she needs now is a man to drive her to the Olympics.” – Conan O’Brien “If you meet the Buddah in the lane, feed him the ball.” – Phil Jackson “Drink wine, and you will sleep well. Sleep, and you will not sin. Avoid sin, and you will be saved. Ergo, drink wine and be saved.” – German Proverb "Everything went smoothly at the sailing events today, except for the British team. They forgot to bring limes and they all got scurvy." - Craig Ferguson “Go to the meadows, go to the garden, go to the woods. Open your eyes.” – Albert Hofman, Sandoz “Have a good weekend, all.” – echo2165 http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pCoFteukqJ0 “Our revels are now ended. These our actors, As I foretold you, were all spirits, and Are melted into air, into thin air; And like the baseless fabric of this vision, The cloud-capp'd towers, the gorgeous palaces, The solemn temples, the great globe itself, Yea, all which it inherit, shall dissolve. And like this insubstantial pageant faded, Leave not a rack behind. We are such stuff As dreams are made on; and our little life Is rounded with a sleep. “ – William Shakespeare
